job_title: Nursing Lab Assistant in Winnsboro, LA
pros: Laid back environment and friendly coworkers
cons: I would often leave due to not having enough work.

job_title: Accounting & Finance in West Monroe, LA
pros: Very flexible work/life balance, good vacation time.
cons: There is very little training, you are expected to "figure it out." There are constant layoffs and "reorganizations." If you are not part of the "in-crowd" then you will not get promotions. Raises are very few and far between.

pros: Nice coworkers and students that care about education
cons: Administration is more concerned about making their career than making sure you have what you need to succeed.

pros: Excellent atmosphere, where one can self-manage and get things done. People here genuinely care about others and work as a team to accomplish tasks.
cons: They compensation is a bit lower than what one could find at larger companies or in other states, performing the same duties.

job_title: Grant Accountant in West Monroe, LA
pros: Retirement Benefits, Vacation, Holiday, Sick Leave
cons: Job insecurity and layoffs and lack of on the job training

pros: There are major incentives to attending a Community college.  Not to mention the obvious financial advantage,and  also it is a place where one can knock out the general courses and explore other interests on a schedule that bests works for the student.  While attending  a Community college one will find some of the best impressive professors that will assist them to the next level of success.  Transitional setting and first time generational students can attend.
cons: Limited curriculum because this is only a two year college, so you will have to transfer to another college to further your education, lighter workload compared  to a four year university and also lack of campus life because juniors colleges do not all have clubs and organizations.

pros: Fellow staff are friendly and make an effort to make you feel welcomed. Flexible about the hours worked.
cons: No professional development, even if it is in your grant. Need 15 students to make a class. Tuition is high with little financial support for students. Will be told in the 11th hour if your class makes and you have a position.

review_title: Growing a program that helps high school students get a jump start on College and Career
pros: A close family type enviroment where everyone works together
Providing services  to individuals and families.
cons: Recruiting for students into the program.
